Getting Started

Zinc is built on top of the net/http package from Go's Standard library, providing a compact and intuitive set of API's that enable developers to build server applications that are inherently idiomatic from inception, to production.

Prerequisites

  • Go 1.22+
  • You must have Go installed on your machine to use the framework. If you don't have it installed, download it before continuing.
  • A text editor or IDE of your choice

Installation

In a new terminal window - paste the following commands to create a new directory, initialise your Go project (new-zinc-app), create a new server.go file, and install 0mjs/zinc from GitHub as a dependency. 

mkdir new-zinc-app && cd new-zinc-app && \
go mod init new-zinc-app && \
touch server.go && \
go get github.com/0mjs/zinc

Basic Usage

You can create a new application by calling zinc.New(). For the sake of an initial example, we'll create a simple route that returns a string response when passed a string value as the second argument (or, in the place of a handler method).

Zinc's .Serve() method infers the default port to be 8080.


server.go 
package main

import "github.com/0mjs/zinc"

func main() {
  app := zinc.New()
  app.Get("/", "Hello, World!")
  app.Serve()
}

Running the server

To run the server: 

go run server.go

Tip: Navigate to http://localhost:8080 in your browser to see the "Hello, World!" message.
